original: gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ru gnas //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ru gnas //
translated: Form exists in four aspects.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sa dang me dang chu dang rlung gi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sa dang me dang chu dang rlung gi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “earth, fire, water, and wind.”

original: 'di sa ni 'di'i rang byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di sa ni 'di'i rang byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the connection, “earth is its self-arisen,” and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshig ste /
translated: “This” is a direct statement.

original: bcom ldan 'das bde ba chen po rang rig pa'i ye shes so //🔽rang byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'i rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur pa'i bde ba chen po ye shes su 'byung ba rnams ji ltar 'dus par 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba thugs la
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bde ba chen po rang rig pa'i ye shes so // rang byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'i rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur pa'i bde ba chen po ye shes su 'byung ba rnams ji ltar 'dus par 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba thugs la
translated: The Bhagavān is the great bliss of self-knowing awareness.🔽“Self-arisen” is because of the nature of the inference of the great elements.

original: bzhag nas lan ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhag nas lan ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having placed in his mind the question, “How should one understand the assembly of the great bliss that arises as gnosis?” he teaches the answer.

original: gal te 'byung ba rnams rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba rnams rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the elements are not of the nature of self-knowing awareness,

original: ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: how can they be experienced?

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes las //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes las //
translated: From the space-like gnosis,

original: ji ltar skyo ba snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar skyo ba snang bar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be any appearance of weariness?

original: zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is inferred.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud kyi dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin zhing //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud kyi dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin zhing //
translated: The destruction of the demon of the afflictions, etc. means that the stains of the demon of the afflictions, etc. are adventitious,

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas rang gi de kho na nyid goms pas 'od gsal ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas rang gi de kho na nyid goms pas 'od gsal ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur pas so //
translated: and that by the cultivation of one's own reality, they are transformed into the clear light, since they are dependent on another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang 'byung ngo //
translated: For that very reason, it is self-arisen.

original: lha nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: As for it is deity, etc.

original: lus la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is deity because it abides in the body.

original: lhag ma nyid ces bya ba don lhag par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma nyid ces bya ba don lhag par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: As for it is the remainder, etc.

original: khams thams cad sdud cing 'dzin pa'am gsal bar byed pas na don lhag ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khams thams cad sdud cing 'dzin pa'am gsal bar byed pas na don lhag ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: it is the remainder because it gathers and holds all the elements, or because it makes them clear.

original: lhag ma ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the remainder?

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for it is what was previously taught, etc.

original: khams rnams zhes bya ba ni khrag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams rnams zhes bya ba ni khrag la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Elements” refers to blood, etc.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the principal ones, he says:

original: phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “aggregates,” etc.

original: khams zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Elements” refers to earth, etc.

original: yang dag par skyed par byed pa zhes @181b bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par skyed par byed pa zhes @181b bya ba ni /
translated: “Properly generate” means

original: da dag skyed par byed pa'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: da dag skyed par byed pa'i sa bon yin te /
translated: that they are the seeds that generate them.

original: khu ba dang khrag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Semen and blood”

original: rtsa las byung ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtsa las byung ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is connected to “arising from the channels.”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rtsa rnams so //
translated: “From that” refers to the channels.

original: yang na de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, “from that”

original: yang dag par byung ba'i sems skye ba las so //
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba'i sems skye ba las so //
translated: refers to the arising of the mind that has arisen.

original: khu ba dang khrag ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag ces bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: “Semen and blood” is a synecdoche.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rang rang gi rtsa las byung ba'i khams rnams bde ba las 'byung ba 'am //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rang rang gi rtsa las byung ba'i khams rnams bde ba las 'byung ba 'am //
translated: Just as they arise from their own channels, the elements arise from pleasure.

original: de dag las kyang bde ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las kyang bde ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: Or, pleasure arises from them.

original: bzhed gzhung gsungs pa zhes ya ba ni rgyud 'dir gsungs pa nyid du gzhan du yang bzhed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzhed gzhung gsungs pa zhes ya ba ni rgyud 'dir gsungs pa nyid du gzhan du yang bzhed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “the scriptures” is that the scriptures of this tantra are accepted as the scriptures of other tantras as well.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: don dam par dbye ba med pas nye bar brtags nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam par dbye ba med pas nye bar brtags nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since there is no division ultimately, having imagined…

original: don dam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Since there is no division ultimately” means

original: yul dang yul can tsam gyis 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang yul can tsam gyis 'brel pa ste /
translated: that there is a connection merely between object and subject.

original: dbang po rnams kyi don rnams nye bar longs spyod pas yul gyi ming yul can la btags pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi don rnams nye bar longs spyod pas yul gyi ming yul can la btags pa'o //
translated: The name of the object is imputed to the subject because of the enjoyment of the objects of the senses.

original: de rnams kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their movement is…

original: de rnams ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: “They” are the senses.

original: nye bar rgyu ba ni yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rgyu ba ni yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: “Movement” is the enjoyment of the objects.

original: byang chub kyi sems thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having attained the thought of awakening…

original: yul dang yul can 'dres nas lhan cig skyes pa ro gcig pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang yul can 'dres nas lhan cig skyes pa ro gcig pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ste /
translated: means having attained the state of the mixing of object and subject, the state of the single taste of the connate.

original: de dag gis ni dam tshig spyod yul yin zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dam tshig spyod yul yin zhes bsnyad do //
translated: They are said to be the domain of the commitments.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special quality of that is stated:

original: 'jig rten gsum du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gsum las zhes bya ba'i yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gsum las zhes bya ba'i yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa ste /
translated: In the three worlds, etc.🔽The enjoyment of objects from the three things with outflows.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa po gsum gyi dmigs pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gsum mo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang 'dzin pa po gsum gyi dmigs pa de ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gsum mo //
translated: The three referents of the apprehended, apprehender, and the one who apprehends are the three things with outflows.

original: rnyed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed dka' ba'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed dka' ba'i bshad pa'o //
translated: “ One will not find” is the explanation of “difficult to find.”

original: byang chub sems kyi khu ba dang bde ba'i shes rab kyi rnam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid gsang ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi khu ba dang bde ba'i shes rab kyi rnam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid gsang ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: In order to teach that very wisdom of nondual seminal essence and bliss of the mind of enlightenment in a hidden way, etc., he says, “Without beginning,” etc., which is easy to understand.

original: rnyed pa bde ba kun myos pas //
analyzed: rnyed pa bde ba kun myos pas //
translated: All happiness is destroyed by intoxication.

original: ngan par spyod pa 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngan par spyod pa 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: Bad conduct will be accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the words, he says, “the Bhagavatī, etc.

original: bha ga dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bha ga dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because she is endowed with a bhaga,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ste bu mo'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ste bu mo'o //
translated: she is the Bhagavatī, the girl.

original: lo brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni ngan par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o //🔽bcas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub @182a * //
analyzed: lo brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni ngan par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o // bcas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub @182a * //
translated: The eight-year-old is the one distinguished by bad conduct.

original: kyi sems so //🔽lha dang mi'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kyi sems so // lha dang mi'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “pledge” is the thought of awakening.

original: lha dang mi dag gi bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi dag gi bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “happiness of gods and men” is the cause of the happiness of gods and men.

original: bsdu ba'i zhes bya ba ni khams thams kyi bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i zhes bya ba ni khams thams kyi bsdu ba ste /
translated: The “collection” is the collection of all the elements,

original: nang gi khams bco brgyad kyis ra sa y'a na sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi khams bco brgyad kyis ra sa y'a na sbyar ba'o //
translated: the eighteen inner elements, which are combined in the rasa.

original: yang na bsdu ba ni rdul chu gzags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bsdu ba ni rdul chu gzags pa ste /
translated: Or, the collection is the emission of semen,

original: de la lo brgyad pa'i khrag dang bcas pa'i khu ba shis pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lo brgyad pa'i khrag dang bcas pa'i khu ba shis pa yin no //
translated: in which the semen of the eight-year-old girl is auspicious.

original: rdo rje'i rdul gyi ni zhes byang chub kyi sems 'phros pa'i rdul gyi cha shas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rdul gyi ni zhes byang chub kyi sems 'phros pa'i rdul gyi cha shas so //
translated: The “dust of the vajra” is a part of the dust of the emission of the thought of awakening.

original: de dang khams rnams lhan cig tu sbyar ba ni mtho ris kyi lha dang mi'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang khams rnams lhan cig tu sbyar ba ni mtho ris kyi lha dang mi'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And the combination of that with the elements should be applied as the cause for attaining the bliss of the gods and humans of the higher realms.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “There, etc.”

original: bu mo zhes bya ba ni lo brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bu mo zhes bya ba ni lo brgyad pa'o //
translated: “Girl” is one of eight years.

original: skud pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa bcu drug go //
analyzed: skud pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa bcu drug go //
translated: “Thread” is the sixteen channels.

original: bsgril ba zhes bya ba ni sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: bsgril ba zhes bya ba ni sgyur ba ste /
translated: “Coiled” is the transformation.

original: de dag gong nas gong du spel ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gong nas gong du spel ba'o //
translated: Those are increased more and more.

original: yang na sum 'gyur du bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sum 'gyur du bya ba ste /
translated: Or, it is tripled.

original: khrag rdul chu'i sum 'gyur du bya ba'o //
analyzed: khrag rdul chu'i sum 'gyur du bya ba'o //
translated: Blood, semen, and water are tripled.

original: chags pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
translated: In “great passion,”

original: 'dis mchod par byed pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas na chags pa chen po ste /
analyzed: 'dis mchod par byed pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas na chags pa chen po ste /
translated: it is great passion because it is worship with this and it is not common.

original: lo brgyad pa las byung ba'i khrag go //
analyzed: lo brgyad pa las byung ba'i khrag go //
translated: It is blood that arises from an eight-year-old girl.

original: 'dis ni bco bor brjod pa ste //
analyzed: 'dis ni bco bor brjod pa ste //
translated: This is said to be the mixture.

original: gzhan las skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan las skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Substances that arise from others should also be taken.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po'i gong du byas la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po'i gong du byas la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, above the essence of the five nectars.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni don de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni don de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: And means the sense of collection. This clarifies that very meaning.

original: yang na bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bdud rtsi lnga'i snying po zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, the essence of the five nectars is blood and semen.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni sde tshan gyis rdzas gzhan bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni sde tshan gyis rdzas gzhan bsdu ba'o //
translated: And is the collection of other substances by means of the class.

original: khams rnams bsdus shing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ston pa yin te /
analyzed: khams rnams bsdus shing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ston pa yin te /
translated: The phrase the elements collected teaches the application.

original: khrag dang khu ba la sogs par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba la sogs par sbyar ba'o //
translated: Blood, semen, and so on are applied.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever and so on.

original: rlan zhes bya ba ni lo brgyad pa'i me tog go //
analyzed: rlan zhes bya ba ni lo brgyad pa'i me tog go //
translated: Moisture is the flower of the eighth year.

original: sa bon zhes bya pa ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya pa ni khu ba'o //
translated: Seed is semen.

original: bsgril te zhes bya ba ni khrag khu ba'i sum 'gyur du bya'o //
analyzed: bsgril te zhes bya ba ni khrag khu ba'i sum 'gyur du bya'o //
translated: Roll means blood and semen should be made three times.

original: brtag pa zhes bya ba ni bcud kyis len du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: brtag pa zhes bya ba ni bcud kyis len du sbyar ba'o //
translated: Consider means it is applied as a rasayana.

original: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term fully matured means

original: lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi 'thungs pa ltar sgrub pa pos longs spyod pa yongs su zhu zhing smin pa'i skad cig la lha dang mi'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi 'thungs pa ltar sgrub pa pos longs spyod pa yongs su zhu zhing smin pa'i skad cig la lha dang mi'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: that, like the gods drinking nectar, the adept consumes the enjoyments and, in the instant of their maturation, attains the bliss of gods and men.

original: bde ba'i gsal bas mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i gsal bas mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term sign of clarity of bliss means

original: byang chub kyi sems dang bcas pa'i lo brgyad pa'i khrag gi sbyor ba nyid bsdus te ston pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang bcas pa'i lo brgyad pa'i khrag gi sbyor ba nyid bsdus te ston pa yin no //
translated: that the adept should collect the blood of an eight-year-old girl endowed with the spirit of enlightenment and use it.

original: des ni khrag dang khu ba so sor @182b gzung la phyis gcig tu sbyor bar bya'o //🔽zhes ston to //
analyzed: des ni khrag dang khu ba so sor @182b gzung la phyis gcig tu sbyor bar bya'o // zhes ston to //
translated: This teaches that one should hold the blood and semen separately and later mix them together.

original: lo brgyad pa ji lta ba bzhin du lo dgu nas bcu drug gi bar gyi bu mo rnams kyi khrag sum 'gyur dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi rdul chu cha re re sbyor ba dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lo brgyad pa ji lta ba bzhin du lo dgu nas bcu drug gi bar gyi bu mo rnams kyi khrag sum 'gyur dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi rdul chu cha re re sbyor ba dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that, just as with an eight-year-old girl, the blood of girls from nine to sixteen years old is tripled, and the spirit of enlightenment is mixed with each part of the water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skud pa bcu drug ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skud pa bcu drug ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, sixteen threads.

original: ji skad du skud pa bcu drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji skad du skud pa bcu drug ces bya ba la /
translated: As it is said, sixteen threads means🔽that one should collect the blood of a sixteen-year-old girl endowed with the spirit of enlightenment and use it.

original: bcu drug lon pa'i bu mor bshad //
analyzed: bcu drug lon pa'i bu mor bshad //
translated: The girl who is sixteen years old.

original: ces gsang ba'i mdzod las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni lo bcu drug ma dang dam tshig la nye bar spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces gsang ba'i mdzod las gsungs pa'i phyir ro // da ni lo bcu drug ma dang dam tshig la nye bar spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is stated in the Secret Treasury.🔽Now, in order to teach the practice of the commitments with a sixteen-year-old,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: sems kyi rdo rje mngon du bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje mngon du bya'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: The mind-vajra should be realized🔽as united with the realm of reality.

original: sems kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The mind-vajra is the co-emergent.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bliss of the co-emergent arises from it.

original: khu ba nyid bcud kyis len la sbyar bas lha dang mi'i bde ba ster bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khu ba nyid bcud kyis len la sbyar bas lha dang mi'i bde ba ster bar bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bde ba bstan pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “from the teaching of bliss.🔽”

original: de dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de dag ni go sla'o //
translated: These are easy to understand.

original: de nyid kyi bsngags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bsngags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the praise of that,

original: de dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “equal to her, etc.

original: rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ” The nature of Vajravārāhī is

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i bdag nyid spros pa'o zhes bya bas bstan te /

original: de dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: These have been explained previously.

original: mthu dang ngo bo nyid dag dang // rang bzhin gyis ni grub pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthu dang ngo bo nyid dag dang // rang bzhin gyis ni grub pa ste // zhes bya ba la /

original: mthu ni stobs so ;
analyzed: mthu ni stobs so ;
translated: Power is strength.

original: / ngo bo nyid ni rdzas rnams te /
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid ni rdzas rnams te /
translated: Nature is the substances.

original: rdzas rnams kyi mthu rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas rnams kyi mthu rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
translated: The power of the substances is naturally established.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i chos nyid zab cing brjod par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i chos nyid zab cing brjod par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The profound reality of dependent origination is inexpressible.

original: gang zhig phyi rol la dga' zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi khams kyi bcud kyis len sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig phyi rol la dga' zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi khams kyi bcud kyis len sbyor ba'o //
translated: One who delights in external means one who delights in the external elements.

original: bcu drug cha zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcu drug cha zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The sixteenth part has been explained.

original: mi phod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi phod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One cannot do it means

original: nang gi bcu drug gi cha'i sbyor ba de la bsgrin pa mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nang gi bcu drug gi cha'i sbyor ba de la bsgrin pa mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one cannot be careful with respect to the practice of the internal sixteen parts.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: That, etc.

original: brda'i tshul gyis gnas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: brda'i tshul gyis gnas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term “secret” is taught by the phrase “the secret of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas.”

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: chung du dang bar ma dang chen po dang chen po'i chan po la sogs pa rnams ma long lta bu'i ye shes lnga'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir me long lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par dag pas kun rdzob kyi bya ba rnams gnas lnga la so sor gnas par bstan pa'i phyir dang / shes @183a * //
analyzed: chung du dang bar ma dang chen po dang chen po'i chan po la sogs pa rnams ma long lta bu'i ye shes lnga'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir me long lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par dag pas kun rdzob kyi bya ba rnams gnas lnga la so sor gnas par bstan pa'i phyir dang / shes @183a * //
translated: In order to teach the purity of the five gnoses, such as the small, medium, great, and greater than great, he says “mirror-like” and so forth.

original: rab kyi gnas lnga'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab kyi gnas lnga'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the conventional activities of the five tathāgatas are individually present in the five places, and in order to teach the divisions of the five topics of knowledge,

original: dbugs dbyung mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbugs dbyung mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “the supreme exhalation” and so forth.

original: dbugs dbyung zhes bya ba ni chung du'o //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung zhes bya ba ni chung du'o //
translated: “Exhalation” is the small.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni chen po dang chen po'i chen po la sogs po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni chen po dang chen po'i chen po la sogs po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Supreme” is the great, greater than great, and so forth.

original: bar ma ni bar ma nyid do //
analyzed: bar ma ni bar ma nyid do //
translated: “Medium” is just medium.

original: dri yi chu dang bcas pas mchod //
analyzed: dri yi chu dang bcas pas mchod //
translated: Worship with scented water.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Thus.

original: dri ni rnam par snang ma dza da do //
analyzed: dri ni rnam par snang ma dza da do //
translated: Odor is Vairocana,

original: chu ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: chu ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: and water is Akshobhya.

original: bcas pa'i sgras rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcas pa'i sgras rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes Ratnasambhava, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“etc.” means semen, etc.

original: khu ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'o //
translated: “etc.” means Ratnasambhava, etc.

original: de dag gis ni bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bdud rtsi lnga'i sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: They teach the union of the five nectars.

original: gnyis par na bcas zhes bya ba ni rdul chu gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis par na bcas zhes bya ba ni rdul chu gzung ba yin no //
translated: “Etc.” means semen and blood, which are held in the second and third moments.

original: de'i tshe snga dro'i dus su sna la sogs pa nas longs spyod par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga dro'i dus su sna la sogs pa nas longs spyod par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: At that time, one should enjoy them in the morning, etc.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu mo las gzhan pa ste gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu mo las gzhan pa ste gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “And others” means the flowers of others, i.e., of a man or woman of another clan.

original: yang na sngags la sogs pa pho nya dang bral ba'i pho nya dag gis me tog kyang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sngags la sogs pa pho nya dang bral ba'i pho nya dag gis me tog kyang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, the messengers, i.e., the messengers without mantras, etc., should hold the flowers.

original: de nyid kyis ni lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni lhan cig skyes //
translated: By that, there is innate bliss.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lhan cig skyes ma la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes ma la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Other than the Innate Goddess, etc.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis dgon pa chen po la sogs pa'i gnas kyi phyogs gzhan ston par mdzad pa yin no //🔽sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis dgon pa chen po la sogs pa'i gnas kyi phyogs gzhan ston par mdzad pa yin no // sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And also etc. the Lord himself shows other places, such as the great forest, etc.

original: sna tshogs ni rnam pa du ma ste zhes bya ba ni brtan pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gsum gyi rang bzhin sna tshogs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rnam pa du ma ste zhes bya ba ni brtan pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gsum gyi rang bzhin sna tshogs so //
translated: The various means the many kinds, the various natures of the three worlds, such as the stable, etc.

original: de nyid bde ba chen po yin pa'i phyir padma'o //
analyzed: de nyid bde ba chen po yin pa'i phyir padma'o //
translated: That itself is the lotus because it is the great bliss.

original: de nyid yon tan sna tshogs dang ldan pas gzung bar bya bas gzungs so //
analyzed: de nyid yon tan sna tshogs dang ldan pas gzung bar bya bas gzungs so //
translated: Dharani is that which is to be held because it possesses various qualities.

original: ras zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsal bar mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ras zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsal bar mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir mi shes pa'o //
translated: The cloth etc. Not clearly divided means the nature of obscuration, which is ignorance because it is not afflicted.

original: de bas na ras ni gsum pa'i sgrar blta par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na ras ni gsum pa'i sgrar blta par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the word “cloth” should be seen as a third case [genitive].

original: ras kyi zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ras kyi zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with “of the lotus.”

original: mi mngon par byas pa ni bkab pa ste /
analyzed: mi mngon par byas pa ni bkab pa ste /
translated: “Covered” means concealed.

original: bde ba chen po lhan cig skyes pa de la bsgrib pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po lhan cig skyes pa de la bsgrib pa'o //
translated: That is the obscuration of the innate great bliss.

original: yang na padma ni thabs so //
analyzed: yang na padma ni thabs so //
translated: Or, the lotus is the method.

original: gzugs ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni shes rab ste /
translated: The form is wisdom.

original: de gnyis sbyor ba las skyes pa'i gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: de gnyis sbyor ba las skyes pa'i gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni tshig bla dags so //
translated: That which is nondual, arisen from the union of those two, is the ultimate.

original: sgrib bde @183b gsal ba'i nye bar spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrib bde @183b gsal ba'i nye bar spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the enjoyment of the bliss of the removal of obscuration,

original: bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “the teaching,” and so on.

original: gdeng zhing kha phye bas na bstan te /
analyzed: gdeng zhing kha phye bas na bstan te /
translated: It is “taught” because it is opened and unfolded.

original: shes rab kyi padma'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi padma'o //
translated: It is the lotus of wisdom.

original: dag pa dang 'jam pa gnyis ni padma'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang 'jam pa gnyis ni padma'i khyad par ro //
translated: The two, pure and soft, are the particularities of the lotus.

original: padma ni chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: padma ni chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: The lotus is the source of phenomena.

original: gos ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: gos ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: “Cloth” is an illustration.

original: gos la sogs pas brgyan pa'o ;
analyzed: gos la sogs pas brgyan pa'o ;
translated: It is adorned with cloth and so on.

original: / yang dang yang du 'dod pas mnyes par bya zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: / yang dang yang du 'dod pas mnyes par bya zhes bya bas ni /
translated: “Again and again, one should please with desire,”

original: mchod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin pa ba de ba'i sgrub pa nyid kyis mchod par bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin pa ba de ba'i sgrub pa nyid kyis mchod par bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The explanation of the word “worship” is that worship is by means of the practice itself, not by anything else.

original: sngom pa yi ni bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sgrub pa de las skyes pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ye shes te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //🔽khrag ni padma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngom pa yi ni bde ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sgrub pa de las skyes pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ye shes te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o // khrag ni padma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme bliss of the vow is the gnosis born from that practice which is the antidote to the obscurations, and which is free from obscurations, the stage of completion.🔽Blood is the lotus.

original: 'dis chags par byed pas na padma la khrag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis chags par byed pas na padma la khrag ces bya'o //
translated: Since it causes passion, blood is called “lotus.”

original: yang na dmar po zhes bya ba ste chags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dmar po zhes bya ba ste chags pa'o //
translated: Or, it is red, that is, passion.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And so,

original: khrag ni bcud kyis len pa ste //
analyzed: khrag ni bcud kyis len pa ste //
translated: Blood is the elixir.

original: zhes bya ba la bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
translated: In the elixir, the word “elixir” is the gnosis of great bliss.

original: de nyid khrag ste yon tan gyis sems can rnams 'chos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid khrag ste yon tan gyis sems can rnams 'chos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is blood, because it is the elixir that heals sentient beings with its qualities.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: And that is stated:

original: sems kyis 'jug pa mnyam shes pa //
analyzed: sems kyis 'jug pa mnyam shes pa //
translated: The knowledge of the equality of mental engagement

original: bcud kyis len zhes bya bar brjod //
analyzed: bcud kyis len zhes bya bar brjod //
translated: Is called the elixir.

original: ces so // bshang ba la sogs pa bcud kyis len to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces so // bshang ba la sogs pa bcud kyis len to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The quintessence of feces, etc.

original: bdud rtsi lnga po dag kyang padma'i khrag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga po dag kyang padma'i khrag ces bya'o //
translated: The five nectars are also called lotus blood.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus it is connected.

original: ra sa y'a na bla med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ra sa y'a na bla med ces bya ba la /
translated: The supreme rasa,

original: bla med ces bya ba ni rkang gi zhag go //
analyzed: bla med ces bya ba ni rkang gi zhag go //
translated: the supreme is marrow.

original: dbang po thams cad las byung ba //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from all the organs,

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas byung ba'i dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas byung ba'i dri ma rnams so //
translated: the impurities arisen from the doors of the organs such as the eyes.

original: de nyid ni mang bas na tshogs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni mang bas na tshogs so //
translated: That itself is a collection because it is abundant.

original: thams cad kyi bcud kyi ra sa y'a na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bcud kyi ra sa y'a na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme rasa of all,

original: ra sa y'a na bla med ces bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ra sa y'a na bla med ces bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: is the explanation of the supreme rasa.

original: yang na tsandan dmar po zhes bya ba ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: yang na tsandan dmar po zhes bya ba ni khu ba'o //
translated: Or, the red sandalwood is the semen.

original: sha zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sha zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: The flesh is bliss.

original: cho gas zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: cho gas zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: The rite is the union.

original: de nyid kyis na dbang po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dbang po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, arisen from all the organs, etc.

original: ra sa y'a na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ra sa y'a na zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Rasayana is co-emergent.

original: bza' bar bya zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar bya ba'o /
analyzed: bza' bar bya zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar bya ba'o /
translated: One should eat means one should experience.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mchod pa zhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod pa zhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Worship is peace.

original: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang / shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po ste de nyid ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang / shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po ste de nyid ni mchod pa'o //
translated: Yoga, Anuyoga, Atiyoga, and Mahayoga are worship.

original: dus bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽yang na bzhi ni stong ba @184a * //
analyzed: dus bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o // yang na bzhi ni stong ba @184a * //
translated: The four times, etc., are easy to understand.

original: nyid kyi da rgyal nas bzung ste mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: nyid kyi da rgyal nas bzung ste mchod pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa 'di yin te /
translated: Or else, the four are from the beginning of the emptiness mandala up to the statement “one should worship.”

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi of the creation stage.

original: dba' bo zhes bya ba nas tshim par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i sgom pa po'i ste zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin te sgra ji bzhin no //
analyzed: dba' bo zhes bya ba nas tshim par bya zhes bya ba'i bar du rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i sgom pa po'i ste zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin te sgra ji bzhin no //
translated: The hero, etc., up to the statement “one should satisfy” is the samadhi of the completion stage, as it is taught.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: tha ma mchog dang bar ma ste //
analyzed: tha ma mchog dang bar ma ste //
translated: The last is the best, the middle one is middling.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na man ngag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin te /🔽tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin dang po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na man ngag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin te / tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhan gyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin dang po ste /
translated: Or else, the three kinds of concentration of instruction are taught.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i lha'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The first is from “the last” up to “the mandala of the deity with signs.”

original: bar ma zhes bya ba nas rang gi dbus su bsdus la zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: bar ma zhes bya ba nas rang gi dbus su bsdus la zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second is from “the middle” up to “dissolve into oneself.”

original: dbus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems su bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: dbus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems su bsdu ba ste /
translated: “Dissolve into oneself” means to dissolve into one’s mind.

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi nang du chos thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi nang du chos thams cad bsdus te /
translated: All phenomena are dissolved into the gnosis of bliss from the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid bde ba chen po rang rig pa tsam dang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes tsam du bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid bde ba chen po rang rig pa tsam dang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes tsam du bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the equality of buddhas is the mere self-awareness of great bliss and the mere gnosis of emptiness.

original: rdo rje kun gyi zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rdo rje kun gyi zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The line all vajras refers to the vajras of the five families.

original: mchog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ste /

translated: The garland of flames of the HUM, moved by the wind, blazes up to the heart.

original: pam las byung ba'i sdig pa'i rang bzhin sha za'i gzugs mdog sngo zhing rnam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: pam las byung ba'i sdig pa'i rang bzhin sha za'i gzugs mdog sngo zhing rnam par 'gyur la /
translated: The form of the flesh-eating demon, the nature of sin, arises from the PAM. It is blue and contorted,

original: rlog pa 'phyad ba snying ga nas sna sgo'i lam nas phyung la /
analyzed: rlog pa 'phyad ba snying ga nas sna sgo'i lam nas phyung la /
translated: and it is expelled from the heart through the nostrils.

original: h'um yang snying gar phyi nas de las byung ba rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gzugs mdog sngo zhing gsus pa 'phyang ba /
analyzed: h'um yang snying gar phyi nas de las byung ba rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gzugs mdog sngo zhing gsus pa 'phyang ba /
translated: The HUM also comes out of the heart and becomes the form of Vajrayaksha, blue and with a pendulous belly.

original: mche ba gtsigs shing g-yas brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs shing g-yas brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands with his right leg straight, with bared fangs,🔽and with his left hand holding a fang and pointing a threatening forefinger at his heart, and with his right hand holding a fang and brandishing it.

original: g-yon pa mche ba bsnams nas snying gar sdigs mdzub mdzad pa g-yas pa mche ba thogs nas 'phyar ba de bzhin du sna'i lam nas phyung la /
analyzed: g-yon pa mche ba bsnams nas snying gar sdigs mdzub mdzad pa g-yas pa mche ba thogs nas 'phyar ba de bzhin du sna'i lam nas phyung la /
translated: He is expelled through the nostrils.

original: aom badzra d'a ki ni kha kha kh'a hi kha' ti sarba p'a pam da ha na bha smim ku ru h'um h'um pha /
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki ni kha kha kh'a hi kha' ti sarba p'a pam da ha na bha smim ku ru h'um h'um pha /
translated: Om vajra dakini kha kha khahi khahi sarva papa dahan bhasmi kuru hum hum phat.

original: ces brjod pas sdig bzos par bsams la /
analyzed: ces brjod pas sdig bzos par bsams la /
translated: By reciting this, imagine that the sins are burned.

original: de nas slob ma sam las kun du bzang por bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas slob ma sam las kun du bzang por bskyed de /
translated: Then, the disciple is generated as Samantabhadra.

original: de'i sems bsrang ba'i phyir khva dgong la sogs pa'i ma mo rnams stong khro bo'i dbyibs can la 'go rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs lta bu rnam sde'i snying ga nas phyung la de'i sems las gyur pa'i bgegs kyi gzo bo rnams la phur bu des btab la
analyzed: de'i sems bsrang ba'i phyir khva dgong la sogs pa'i ma mo rnams stong khro bo'i dbyibs can la 'go rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs lta bu rnam sde'i snying ga nas phyung la de'i sems las gyur pa'i bgegs kyi gzo bo rnams la phur bu des btab la
translated: In order to purify his mind, the mamos such as Khaṇḍakapālinī are expelled from the heart of the wrathful one in the form of a single-pointed vajra.

original: / yang phur bu de nyid kyi 'od kyis bgegs kyi tshogs lhag ma rnams sreg par bsam mo //
analyzed: / yang phur bu de nyid kyi 'od kyis bgegs kyi tshogs lhag ma rnams sreg par bsam mo //
translated: Then, imagine that the remaining assembly of obstructors is burned by the light of that kīla.

original: de nas slob ma'i snying gar h'um las bskyed pa'i rdo rje bsgoms pa la de'i spyi bo'i steng du aa las byed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge ham gyis mtshan pa'i rdo rje rgyu gram bsgom pa de ni slob ma yongs su gzung ba'o
analyzed: de nas slob ma'i snying gar h'um las bskyed pa'i rdo rje bsgoms pa la de'i spyi bo'i steng du aa las byed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge ham gyis mtshan pa'i rdo rje rgyu gram bsgom pa de ni slob ma yongs su gzung ba'o
translated: Then, the vajra generated from hūṃ at the heart of the disciple is visualized. Above his head, on a moon maṇḍala generated from a, visualize a vajra marked with hūṃ, the nature of the vajra chain. That is the complete acceptance of the disciple.

original: / de nas rang gi rig pa lan khri 'am 'bum mam bye ba nyid du bzlas la grogs bzang po dang lhan cig tu snga dro'i du su dkyil 'khor gyis brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: / de nas rang gi rig pa lan khri 'am 'bum mam bye ba nyid du bzlas la grogs bzang po dang lhan cig tu snga dro'i du su dkyil 'khor gyis brtag par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should recite one's own vidya ten thousand, one hundred thousand, or ten million times. Together with a good friend, one should examine the mandala in the morning.

original: grong khyer la sogs pa'i shar ram byang gi cha gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs pa'i shar ram byang gi cha gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should take the eastern or northern part of a city, and so on.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: As is said:

original: @187b gtsug lag khang dang tshong dus dang // ldum ra grong dam grong khyer ni //
analyzed: @187b gtsug lag khang dang tshong dus dang // ldum ra grong dam grong khyer ni //
translated: A temple, marketplace, garden, village, or city

original: shar dang byang gi sa yi cha //
analyzed: shar dang byang gi sa yi cha //
translated: In the eastern or northern part of the land

original: mnyam par bzhag ste gzung bar bya //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag ste gzung bar bya //
translated: Should be taken while in equipoise.

original: zhes so // yang na nags tshal la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: zhes so // yang na nags tshal la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Or, it is suitable to do it in another place, such as a forest, and so on.

original: mdor na gnag yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su sman pa la sogs pa'i dngos gru byi bye brag gis pus mo nub ba tsa la sogs pa'i sa bkros la /
analyzed: mdor na gnag yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su sman pa la sogs pa'i dngos gru byi bye brag gis pus mo nub ba tsa la sogs pa'i sa bkros la /
translated: In brief, in a place that is pleasing to the mind, one should level the ground with one's knee, and so on, with the particular preparations, such as medicine, and so on.

original: phub ma la sogs pa sa'i skyon rnams bsal te /
analyzed: phub ma la sogs pa sa'i skyon rnams bsal te /
translated: One should remove the faults of the ground, such as pebbles, and so on.

original: slar legs par btsugs la /
analyzed: slar legs par btsugs la /
translated: Then, having leveled it well,

original: sa'i mtshan nyid brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to examine the characteristics of the ground,

original: mtho gang tsam gyi sa'i dong legs par brkos la chus bkang ste /
analyzed: mtho gang tsam gyi sa'i dong legs par brkos la chus bkang ste /
translated: Having dug a pit in the ground one cubit deep and filled it with water,

original: shar phyogs su yid mi g-ying ba'i gom ba brgyad phyin la slar log ste pa lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su yid mi g-ying ba'i gom ba brgyad phyin la slar log ste pa lta bar bya'o //
translated: one should walk eight steps to the east without moving the mind, and return.

original: ji ste phyed min cad du bskams bar gyur na ni mi dge ba'i mtshan ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ste phyed min cad du bskams bar gyur na ni mi dge ba'i mtshan ma yin la /
translated: If the water is half-depleted, it is a sign of non-virtue.

original: gzhan du ni dge ba'i mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni dge ba'i mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is a sign of virtue.

original: de nas sa dri zhim zhing bdud rtsi lnga dang dri ma him po dang bcas bas khung bu bkang la /
analyzed: de nas sa dri zhim zhing bdud rtsi lnga dang dri ma him po dang bcas bas khung bu bkang la /
translated: Then, having filled the pit with fragrant earth and the five nectars and perfumes,

original: aom badzra d'a ki ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngas bzlas pa'i chus gtor te mtshan nyid dang ldan par legs par gdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngas bzlas pa'i chus gtor te mtshan nyid dang ldan par legs par gdung bar bya'o //
translated: one should sprinkle it with water enchanted with the mantra Om Vajra Dakini and so forth, and level it well with the characteristics.

original: de nas rin po che la sogs pa dang / 'brul sogs pa sa'i dbus su bcug nas phyogs bzhir rta babs dang / dril bu dang bcas pa'i ba dan btsugs nas /
analyzed: de nas rin po che la sogs pa dang / 'brul sogs pa sa'i dbus su bcug nas phyogs bzhir rta babs dang / dril bu dang bcas pa'i ba dan btsugs nas /
translated: Then, having placed jewels and so forth and grains and so forth in the center of the ground, having erected canopies with banners and bells in the four directions,

original: bdud rtsi lngas byugs te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lngas byugs te /
translated: and having anointed it with the five nectars,

original: sngar bshad pa'i bdug pas bdugs nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha gzhal las khar brtsegs pa'i nad du chud par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bdug pas bdugs nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha gzhal las khar brtsegs pa'i nad du chud par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having fumigated with the previously explained incense, one should meditate on the area of the maṇḍala as filled with the celestial mansion.

original: de nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas sngar pa rnams bsal bar bya'i phyir g-yas g-yon kyi phyogs kun du mig gis bltas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas sngar pa rnams bsal bar bya'i phyir g-yas g-yon kyi phyogs kun du mig gis bltas la /
translated: Then, endowed with the yoga of the Vajraḍāka, one should look with one’s eyes in all directions, to the right and left, in order to clear away the previous [defilements].

original: phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should bind the directions, and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor du byas la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor du byas la /
translated: After that, having made oneself into the yoga of Akṣobhya,

original: lam las byung ba ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lha mos lag pas la reg pa dang / aom ae dze ye ji zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bskul la /
analyzed: lam las byung ba ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lha mos lag pas la reg pa dang / aom ae dze ye ji zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bskul la /
translated: one should touch the ground with one’s hand, and incite the goddess endowed with the characteristics arisen from the path, as previously explained, with the mantra “Oṃ e vajrī jīḥ.”

original: dri la sogs pa thams cad kyis mchod de /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa thams cad kyis mchod de /
translated: One should worship with all the perfumes, and so forth.

original: gsol ba btab nas de nyid du thim par bsgom mo //
analyzed: gsol ba btab nas de nyid du thim par bsgom mo //
translated: Having made a request, one should meditate on her dissolving into oneself.

original: khang bzang la sogs pa la ni brko ba la sogs pa ma byas par yi ge gsum gyi sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa nyid kyis sa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khang bzang la sogs pa la ni brko ba la sogs pa ma byas par yi ge gsum gyi sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa nyid kyis sa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a mansion and so forth, one should take possession of the ground by merely reciting the mantra of the three syllables one hundred and eight times without digging and so forth.

original: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
translated: Then, the master himself should be adorned with all ornaments.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnal 'byor du byas la /🔽dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i chi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i nang du chung par lhag bar mos pas sa'i cha dbus @188a * //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnal 'byor du byas la / dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i chi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i nang du chung par lhag bar mos pas sa'i cha dbus @188a * //
translated: Having performed the yoga of Vajradaka,🔽one should imagine that the ground of the mandala is the interior of a multistoried celestial mansion.

original: kyi stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: kyi stan la 'dug ste /
translated: Sitting on the seat in the center of the ground,

original: spro ba dang bcas pas 'di skad ces /
analyzed: spro ba dang bcas pas 'di skad ces /
translated: with enthusiasm one should say this:

original: de ring bdag ni 'bras bur ldan //
analyzed: de ring bdag ni 'bras bur ldan //
translated: Today I am fruitful,

original: bdag gsol ba yang 'bras bor yod //🔽lha dang dam tshig gis mnyam par //
analyzed: bdag gsol ba yang 'bras bor yod // lha dang dam tshig gis mnyam par //
translated: my request is also fruitful.🔽I have no doubt that

original: gyur par bdag ni the tshom med //
analyzed: gyur par bdag ni the tshom med //
translated: I have become equal to the deity through the pledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems gcig las //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems gcig las //
translated: From a single thought of the thought of enlightenment

original: phyir mi ldog par bdag bgyid do //🔽deng bdag de bzhin gshegs pa yi //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par bdag bgyid do // deng bdag de bzhin gshegs pa yi //
translated: I will make myself irreversible.🔽Today I have been born into the family

original: rigs su skye bar the tshom med //
analyzed: rigs su skye bar the tshom med //
translated: of the Tathagata, I have no doubt.

original: deng bdag nyi ma dam pa ste //
analyzed: deng bdag nyi ma dam pa ste //
translated: Today I am the holy sun,

original: bdag gi mchod sbyin bla na med //
analyzed: bdag gi mchod sbyin bla na med //
translated: my sacrifice is unsurpassed,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad spyan 'dren pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad spyan 'dren pas //
translated: I invite all the buddhas,

original: ded bdag 'dus pa'i mchog yin no //🔽zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽de nas yan lag thams cad kyis /
analyzed: ded bdag 'dus pa'i mchog yin no // zhes brjod par bya'o // de nas yan lag thams cad kyis /
translated: therefore I am the best of assemblies.

original: phyag byas la /
analyzed: phyag byas la /
translated: Then, having prostrated with all limbs,

original: spos kyi reng bu lag tu thogs nas /
analyzed: spos kyi reng bu lag tu thogs nas /
translated: holding a stick of incense in the hand,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la snyan gsan dbab par bya ste /🔽ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la snyan gsan dbab par bya ste / ma lus phyogs na bzhugs pa yi //
translated: one should invite all the buddhas,🔽saying:🔽All the buddhas dwelling in the endless directions,

original: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
translated: please heed me!

original: rdo rje can bdag che ge mos //
analyzed: rdo rje can bdag che ge mos //
translated: I, so-and-so, the vajra holder,

original: dkyil 'khor brgya po bstan par bgyi //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brgya po bstan par bgyi //
translated: will reveal the mandala.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs 'dir gshegs nas ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs 'dir gshegs nas ;
translated: Having come here, buddhas and so forth,

original: / dngos grub 'dir ni stsal du gsol //
analyzed: / dngos grub 'dir ni stsal du gsol //
translated: please grant the spiritual powers here.

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite:

original: de nas / aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rmm'a: sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
analyzed: de nas / aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rmm'a: sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhaḥ sarvadharmaḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ

original: aom badzra shddha: sarba dhrmm'a: badzra shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra shddha: sarba dhrmm'a: badzra shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ vajra śuddhaḥ sarvadharmaḥ vajra śuddho ’haṃ

original: aom yo ga shuddha: sarbba dharmm'a: yo ga shuddh'o & ham /
analyzed: aom yo ga shuddha: sarbba dharmm'a: yo ga shuddh'o & ham /
translated: oṃ yoga śuddhaḥ sarvadharmā yoga śuddho ’haṃ

original: zhes brjod la /
analyzed: zhes brjod la /
translated: Recite this and

original: lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid lhag par mos pas bdag nyid dbus su gnas pa la /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid lhag par mos pas bdag nyid dbus su gnas pa la /
translated: imagine that you are Vajraḍāka by nature, and that you are in the center.🔽The disciples, holding vajra and bell, request the master, holding vajra and bell,

original: slob ma rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir gsol ba gdab pa dang / slob dpon rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas /
analyzed: slob ma rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir gsol ba gdab pa dang / slob dpon rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas /
translated: to draw the maṇḍala.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas te /🔽mig g-yon du tam las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag byas te / mig g-yon du tam las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: After bowing to all buddhas,🔽in the left eye a moon maṇḍala arises from taṃ,

original: g-yas su mam las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyad la /
analyzed: g-yas su mam las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyad la /
translated: and in the right eye a sun maṇḍala arises from maṃ.

original: phyogs kun du blta zhing rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal bsgyings nas sa'i cha kun du bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kun du blta zhing rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal bsgyings nas sa'i cha kun du bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Looking in all directions, one should circle the area, with the pride of being Vajradhara.

original: de nas aom a'a: h'um lam h'um zhes brjod pas dkyil 'khor gyi sa rdo rje'i rang bzhin du sprul la /
analyzed: de nas aom a'a: h'um lam h'um zhes brjod pas dkyil 'khor gyi sa rdo rje'i rang bzhin du sprul la /
translated: Then, by reciting oṃ āḥ hūṃ laṃ hūṃ, the area of the maṇḍala is emanated as vajra.

original: aom badzra me di n'i badza'i bha ba h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra me di n'i badza'i bha ba h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-medini vajra-bhavan hūṃ.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su dkyil 'khor pa'i lha mum tsu rtsa drug pas bskor ba'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro bsams la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su dkyil 'khor pa'i lha mum tsu rtsa drug pas bskor ba'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro bsams la /
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala ground, one should visualize Vajraḍāka surrounded by the maṇḍala deities, with the six-syllable [mantra].

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams stong khro bo'i gzugs can la /
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams stong khro bo'i gzugs can la /
translated: One should meditate on Kākāsyā and so forth in the form of the wrathful ones,

original: smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i gzugs can du bsgoms te /
analyzed: smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i gzugs can du bsgoms te /
translated: with the lower part in the form of a single-pointed vajra.

original: dbang po la sogs pa bgegs kyi snying gar brdung zhing dril bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa bgegs kyi snying gar brdung zhing dril bar bya ste /
translated: One should beat the hearts of the obstructors such as Indra, and ring the bell,

original: sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: reciting this mantra:

original: aom badzra d'a ki ni sarbba bi ghn'am @188b aa nu so da ye k'i la ya h'um phat ces so //
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki ni sarbba bi ghn'am @188b aa nu so da ye k'i la ya h'um phat ces so //
translated: Oṃ vajra-ḍākinī sarva-vighnān anusaṃyojaya kila ya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin par nga rgyal byas la /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin par nga rgyal byas la /
translated: Then, having generated pride as Vajradhara,

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bsgoms na srung pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bsgoms na srung pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: if one meditates on all phenomena as equal to space, it becomes the supreme protection.

original: de nas rdo rje mda'i dra ba la sogs pa bkod la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje mda'i dra ba la sogs pa bkod la /
translated: Then, having arranged the vajra net and so forth,

original: rkang mthil du rdo rje rgya gram bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rkang mthil du rdo rje rgya gram bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on a vajra cross on the soles of the feet,

original: gar dang bcas pa'i rdo rje 'gros kyis kun du bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gar dang bcas pa'i rdo rje 'gros kyis kun du bskor bar bya'o //
translated: one should circumambulate with the vajra gait together with dancing.

original: de nas tsandan la sogs pa'i dris /
analyzed: de nas tsandan la sogs pa'i dris /
translated: Then, with the scent of sandalwood, etc.,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i gnas lnga'i gnas su ni mandala gru bzhi par bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i gnas lnga'i gnas su ni mandala gru bzhi par bya la /
translated: in the five places of the yoginī purified of the five tathāgatas, one should make a square maṇḍala,

original: dkyil 'khor pa lhag ma'i gnas su ni mandala zlum por byas la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa lhag ma'i gnas su ni mandala zlum por byas la /
translated: and in the place of the remaining maṇḍala, one should make a round maṇḍala,

original: thams cad du bdud rtsi lngas byug par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bdud rtsi lngas byug par bya'o //
translated: and everywhere one should anoint with the five elixirs.

translated: and again having cast lines in the east, west, north, and south, he should make an eight-part maṇḍala.

analyzed: de dag thams cad la yang yi ge gsum gyi sngags bzlas pa sngon du 'gro bas /

original: thig bri ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: thig bri ba'i cho ga'o //

analyzed: de nas rdul tshon rnams bhr'um la sogs pa'i sa bon las bskyed de /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms te /
translated: and meditate on them as having the nature of all the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba mngon par bzlas nas / dza'i 'bar ba'i lta bas bltas te /

analyzed: rul tshon 'bar bar bsgom par bya'o //

original: de nas h'um zhes bya bas dbus kyi phur bu bton la /
analyzed: de nas h'um zhes bya bas dbus kyi phur bu bton la /
translated: Then, with the utterance of “hūṃ, ” one should extract the central dagger.

original: de'i khung bu rdul tshon sna lnga sa bkang ste /
analyzed: de'i khung bu rdul tshon sna lnga sa bkang ste /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings can par dag par mos par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'dug ste /

analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams nas brtsams la /

analyzed: kha shar du bltas la lag pa g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis @190a * //

analyzed: tshon g-yas skor gyis bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: sngags ni aom badzra tsi tra sam ya h'um zhes bya ba la 'di yin no //
translated: The mantra is “oṃ vajra citra samayā hūṃ. ”

original: de'i 'og tu ci bder bri bar bya'o //
